# Airport Security Requirements Review

## Tagline

Develop a comprehensive assessment of airport security classification and physical security requirements to ensure alignment with modern and flexible classification systems.

### Notice of Proposed Purchases (NPP)

Transport Canada invites suppliers to submit a proposal for the development of a security classification and physical security requirements assessment for Canadian airports. This assessment will help Transport Canada identify areas for improvement and ensure compliance with modern and flexible classification systems.

### Overview

The proposed contract will be awarded to a supplier who can conduct research and analysis of existing policies and regulations surrounding airport security classification and physical security requirements. Site visits will be conducted at Canadian and international airports to gather information and develop a comprehensive assessment.

The awarded supplier will be responsible for:

* Conducting research and analysis of existing policies and regulations
* Conducting site visits at Canadian and international airports
* Developing a comprehensive assessment
* Providing recommendations to Transport Canada
* Reporting the findings and results

### Security Clearance

The awarded supplier must hold a valid Designated Organization Screening (DOS) issued by the Contract Security Program (CSP), Public Works and Government Services Canada (PWGSC). Additionally, personnel with access to Protected information, assets, or sensitive sites must hold a valid Reliability Status granted or approved by the CSP, PWGSC.

### Trade Agreements

This procurement is governed by the Canada Free Trade Agreement (CFTA), Canada-Chile Free Trade Agreement (CCFTA), Canada-Colombia Free Trade Agreement (CCoFTA), Canada-Honduras Free Trade Agreement (CHFTA), Canada-Korea Free Trade Agreement (CKFTA), Canada-Panama Free Trade Agreement (CPaFTA), and Canada-Peru Free Trade Agreement (CPFTA).
